content:
I totally get it! We've all been there, and it's great that you're acknowledging it and wanting to get back on track. Convenience can be a major obstacle to healthy eating, but don't worry, I've got you covered! Here are some quick, easy, and healthy snack ideas to help you get back on track:

**Fresh Fruits & Veggies**

1. Fresh fruit skewers with yogurt dip ( prep in 5 minutes)
2. Baby carrots with hummus (2 minutes)
3. Apple slices with almond butter (2 minutes)
4. Cut veggies (bell peppers, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes) with guacamole (5 minutes)

**Nuts & Seeds**

1. Trail mix with nuts, seeds, and dried fruits ( prep in 5 minutes)
2. Roasted chickpeas seasoned with herbs and spices (10 minutes)
3. Handful of almonds or cashews (no prep needed!)

**Protein-Packed Snacks**

1. Hard-boiled eggs (10 minutes to prep a batch)
2. Greek yogurt with honey and nuts (2 minutes)
3. Cottage cheese with fruit or cucumber slices (2 minutes)

**Whole Grain Goodies**

1. Whole grain crackers with peanut butter and banana slices (2 minutes)
2. Oatmeal with fruit and nuts (5 minutes)
3. Whole grain toast with avocado and eggs (5 minutes)

**No-Bake Energy Bites**

1. Oat and nut energy balls (10 minutes to prep a batch)
2. Energy balls with peanut butter and honey (10 minutes to prep a batch)

**Other Quickies**

1. Smoothie (2-3 minutes to blend)
2. Edamame (boil in 3-4 minutes)
3. Air-popped popcorn (2-3 minutes)

These snacks are all quick, easy, and nutritious, and can be prepped in no more than 10-15 minutes. Try to aim for a balance of protein, healthy fats, and complex carbs to keep you full and satisfied between meals.

Remember, it's all about small steps towards a healthier lifestyle. Start with one or two new snack ideas and gradually add more as you get back into the habit. Good luck, and don't be too hard on yourself – you got this!
